document_metadata.name: Tau Effect on Mitochondria
document_metadata.description: Tau and mitochondria section of NESTOR

links.evidence: Mitochondrial dysfunction found to be reduced in TauXDrp1Ã¾/+- mice relative to Tau mice. Phosphorylated Tau levels were significantly reduced in TauXDrp1Ã¾/+- mice relative to Tau mice. These findings suggest that a partial reduction of Drp1 decreases the levels of phosphorylated Tau, reduces mitochondrial dysfunction, and maintains mitochondrial dynamics, enhances mitochondrial biogenesis and synaptic activity in Tau mice.

citation.name: Human molecular genetics
citation.title: Reduced dynamin-related protein 1 protects against phosphorylated Tau-induced mitochondrial dysfunction and synaptic damage in Alzheimer's disease.

links.evidence: Using real-time RT-PCR, immunoblotting and immunostaining analyses, we measured mRNA expressions and protein levels of genes related to the mitochondrial dynamicsâDrp1 and Fis1 (fission), Mfn1, Mfn2 and Opa1 (fusion), CypD (matrix), mitochondrial biogenesisâNrf1, Nrf2, PGC1a and TFAM and synapticâ synaptophysin, PSD95, synapsin 1, synaptobrevin 1, neurogranin, GAP43 and synaptopodin in brain tissues from 6-month old Drp1Ã¾/+-, Tau, TauXDrp1Ã¾/+- and wild-type mice. Decreased mRNA and protein levels of fission and matrix and increased levels of fusion, mitochondrial biogenesis, and synaptic genes were found in 6-month-old TauXDrp1Ã¾/+- mice relative to Tau mice. Mitochondrial dysfunction was reduced in TauXDrp1Ã¾/+- mice relative to Tau mice.

citation.title: Reduced dynamin-related protein 1 protects against phosphorylated Tau-induced mitochondrial dysfunction and synaptic damage in Alzheimer's disease.
